class SkAutoBitmapShaderInstall

Detailed Description

SkShader is the based class for objects that return horizontal spans of colors during drawing. A subclass of SkShader is installed in a SkPaint calling paint.setShader(shader). After that any object (other than a bitmap) that is drawn with that paint will get its color(s) from the shader.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum SkShader::Flags
 

Enumeration values:
kOpaqueAlpha_Flag  set if all of the colors will be opaque (if so, kConstAlpha_Flag will not be set)
kConstAlpha_Flag  set if all of the colors have the same (non-opaque) alpha
kHasSpan16_Flag  set if this shader's shadeSpanOpaque16() method can be called

enum SkShader::TileMode
 

Enumeration values:
kClamp_TileMode  replicate the edge color if the shader draws outside of its original bounds
kRepeat_TileMode  repeat the shader's image horizontally and vertically
kMirror_TileMode  repeat the shader's image horizontally and vertically, alternating mirror images so that adjacent images always seam

Member Function Documentation

static bool SkShader::CanCallShadeSpanOpaque16 (  U32  flags  )  [inline, static]
 

Helper to check the flags to know if it is legal to call shadeSpanOpaque16()

bool SkShader::canCallShadeSpanOpaque16 (   )  [inline]
 

Helper function that returns true if this shader's shadeSpanOpaque16() method can be called.

static SkShader* SkShader::CreateBitmapShader (  const SkBitmap &  src,
bool  transferOwnershipOfPixels,
SkPaint::FilterType  ft,
TileMode  tm
)  [static]
 

Call this to create a new shader that will draw with the specified bitmap.

Parameters:
src The bitmap to use inside the shader
transferOwnershipOfPixels If true, the shader will call setOwnsPixels(true) on its private bitmap and setOwnsPixels(false) on the src bitmap, resulting in the bitmap's pixels being disposed when the shader is deleted.
ft The filter type to be used when scaling or rotating the bitmap when it is drawn.
tm The tiling mode to draw the bitmap in.
Returns:
Returns a new shader object. Note: this function never returns nil.

virtual U32 SkShader::getFlags (   )  [virtual]
 

Called sometimes before drawing with this shader. Return the type of alpha your shader will return. The default implementation returns 0. Your subclass should override if it can (even sometimes) report a non-zero value, since that will enable various blitters to perform faster.

Reimplemented in SkLightShader.

const SkMatrix* SkShader::getLocalMatrix (   )  const [inline]
 

Return the shader's optional local matrix, or nil.

virtual bool SkShader::setContext (  const SkBitmap &  device,
const SkPaint &  paint,
const SkMatrix &  matrix
)  [virtual]
 

Called once before drawing, with the current paint and device matrix. Return true if your shader supports these parameters, or false if not. If false is returned, nothing will be drawn.

Reimplemented in SkLightShader.

void SkShader::setLocalMatrix (  const SkMatrix &   ) 
 

Set the shader's optional local matrix. If the specified matrix is identity, then getLocalMatrix() will return nil.

virtual void SkShader::shadeSpan (  int  x,
int  y,
SkPMColor  [],
int  count
)  [pure virtual]
 

Called for each span of the object being drawn. Your subclass should set the appropriate colors (with premultiplied alpha) that correspond to the specified device coordinates.

Implemented in SkLightShader.

virtual void SkShader::shadeSpanAlpha (  int  x,
int  y,
U8  alpha[],
int  count
)  [virtual]
 

Similar to shadeSpan, but only returns the alpha-channel for a span. The default implementation calls shadeSpan() and then extracts the alpha values from the returned colors.

virtual void SkShader::shadeSpanOpaque16 (  int  x,
int  y,
U16  [],
int  count
)  [virtual]
 

Called only for 16bit devices when getFlags() returns kOpaqueAlphaFlag | kHasSpan16_Flag
